intro: Ruellia pipericaulis, commonly known as the purple-leaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple foliage and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright herb or shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while the flowers are clustered in whorls at the ends of the stems. Ruellia pipericaulis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
